description: JSON Schema for address class in Elephant Lexicon

block.description: A block is a further subdivision within a plat (a recorded land division), often used in urban or planned developments. Block 0000G refers to a specific block within that recorded subdivision

city_name.description: City name refers to the name of the city in which the address is located. Must be in all capital letters.

country_code.description: Country code is a code that represents the country in which the address is located.

county_name.description: County name refers to the name of the county in which the address is located.

latitude.description: Latitude is a coordinate that specifies the north-south position of a point on the Earth's surface. It is an angular measurement, usually expressed in degrees, with values ranging from -90° at the South Pole to +90° at the North Pole.

longitude.description: Longitude is a coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point on the Earth's surface. It is an angular measurement, usually expressed in degrees, with values ranging from -180° to +180°.

lot.description: A specific parcel or unit of land within a subdivision or plat, identified by a unique lot number or code assigned during the subdivision platting process.

municipality_name.description: he incorporated city, town, or village in which the property is located, responsible for providing local government services and regulations.

plus_four_postal_code.description: A postal code plus four, also known as a ZIP code plus four (in the United States) is a numerical extension to a postal code.

postal_code.description: A postal code, also known as a ZIP code (in the United States) or postcode (in many other countries), is a numerical code used by postal services to identify specific geographic areas for efficient mail sorting and delivery.

range.description: A range describes the east-west position of a township relative to a principal meridian. Range 24E means the township is located 24 tiers east of the principal meridian

request_identifier.description: Identifier value that should be substituted into the source HTTP request to retrieve this specific data.

route_number.description: A route number is a unique identifier assigned to a specific transportation route, such as a road, highway, or public transit line. It is used to distinguish one route from another and is often displayed on signs or maps.

section.description: Each township is divided into 36 sections, with each section being 1 square mile (640 acres). Section 03 refers to the third section within its township

source_http_request.description: HTTP request configuration for retrieving this data.

body.description: The body of the request, which may contain JSON or other data formats.

content-type.description: Content-Type header for the request, indicating the media type of the resource.

url.description: The URL endpoint for the request.

state_code.description: State code is a code that represents the state in which the address is located.

township.description: A township is a 6-mile by 6-mile square of land, covering 36 square miles. Townships are numbered north or south from a designated baseline. In this case, Township 45 refers to the 45th tier of townships from the baseline.

unit_identifier.description: A unit identifier is a reference to the specific unit, suite, apartment, or other secondary identifier associated with an address. It is used to differentiate individual units within a larger building or complex.

unnormalized_address.description: The original, unprocessed address as it appears in source data, preserving the raw format and any inconsistencies.

city_name.description: City name refers to the name of the city in which the address is located. Must be in all capital letters.

longitude.description: Longitude is a coordinate that specifies the east-west position of a point on the Earth's surface. It is an angular measurement, usually expressed in degrees, with values ranging from -180° to +180°.

source_http_request.description: HTTP request configuration for retrieving this data.

body.description: The body of the request, which may contain JSON or other data formats.

content-type.description: Content-Type header for the request, indicating the media type of the resource.

url.description: The URL endpoint for the request.

state_code.description: State code is a code that represents the state in which the address is located.

street_name.description: A street name that doesn't contain directional abbreviations

street_number.description: Street  number refers to the numerical part of a street address that indicates the specific location or position of a building or property along a street.

street_post_directional_text.description: Street post directional text refers to the directional indicator or suffix added to a street name to provide additional information about the direction or orientation of the street segment. It helps to clarify the position of a particular street in relation to other streets or landmarks in a given area.

street_pre_directional_text.description: Street pre directional text refers to the directional indicator or prefix added to a street name to provide additional information about the direction or orientation of the street segment. It helps to clarify the position of a particular street in relation to other streets or landmarks in a given area.

township.description: A township is a 6-mile by 6-mile square of land, covering 36 square miles. Townships are numbered north or south from a designated baseline. In this case, Township 45 refers to the 45th tier of townships from the baseline.

unit_identifier.description: A unit identifier is a reference to the specific unit, suite, apartment, or other secondary identifier associated with an address. It is used to differentiate individual units within a larger building or complex.

title: address
